name: Genetic Counseling Interview Protocol
description: Protocol for understanding experiences with genetic testing, counseling, and decision-making during pregnancy regarding genetic conditions and screening.

questions.text: Can you tell me about yourself and your current pregnancy?
follow_up_prompts: How far along are you in your pregnancy?
Is this your first pregnancy?
What brings you to genetic counseling?

questions.text: Can you tell me about your family's health history? Are there any genetic conditions in your or your partner's family?
follow_up_prompts: Are there conditions that run in the family?
Have any family members had genetic testing?
What do you know about inherited conditions?

questions.text: What led to your referral for genetic counseling?
follow_up_prompts: Was it based on family history, age, or screening results?
Were you referred by your OB or did you self-refer?
What were you told about why counseling was recommended?

questions.text: Have you met with a genetic counselor? Can you describe that experience?
follow_up_prompts: Did the counselor explain things clearly?
Did you feel comfortable asking questions?
How long did the session last?

questions.text: What genetic tests have been offered or discussed with you?
follow_up_prompts: Were you offered carrier screening?
Was prenatal testing discussed (NIPT, amniocentesis, CVS)?
What conditions do these tests screen for?

questions.text: Have you decided whether to have genetic testing? What factors influenced your decision?
follow_up_prompts: What made you choose to test or not test?
Did you discuss this with your partner?
Were there cultural or religious considerations?

questions.text: Do you feel you understand the risks and benefits of genetic testing?
follow_up_prompts: What do you understand about what the tests can and cannot tell you?
Were the limitations of testing explained?
Do you understand the risk of false positives or uncertain results?

questions.text: If you had testing, have you received results? Can you tell me about that?
follow_up_prompts: How were results communicated to you?
Did you understand what the results mean?
Were you offered follow-up counseling to discuss results?

questions.text: How has going through genetic counseling and testing affected you emotionally?
follow_up_prompts: Has this process caused anxiety or stress?
How are you coping with uncertainty?
Do you have emotional support?

questions.text: If test results indicated a concern, were options discussed with you?
follow_up_prompts: Were you presented with all available options?
Did you feel pressured in any direction?
Do you feel you had adequate time to make decisions?

questions.text: Do you feel you have enough information about genetic conditions and testing?
follow_up_prompts: What sources of information have you used?
What questions do you still have?
Would you like more information about anything specific?

questions.text: How involved has your partner been in the genetic counseling process?
follow_up_prompts: Did your partner attend counseling sessions?
Are you making decisions together?
Do you and your partner agree on testing decisions?

questions.text: Have you faced any challenges accessing genetic counseling or testing?
follow_up_prompts: Was it easy to get an appointment?
Are there financial or insurance barriers?
How far did you have to travel?

questions.text: Are there any cultural or religious beliefs that affect your views on genetic testing?
follow_up_prompts: Does your community have particular views on genetic testing?
Did the counselor respect your cultural background?
Have you consulted with religious or community leaders?

questions.text: If applicable: How do you feel about the focus on age-related genetic risks?
follow_up_prompts: Were you told about increased risks due to age?
How did that information affect you?
Do you feel age-based risk counseling was appropriate?

questions.text: Have you had genetic counseling or testing in previous pregnancies?
follow_up_prompts: How does this experience compare?
What did you learn from previous testing?
Have your views on testing changed?

questions.text: Has genetic counseling affected how you think about future pregnancies or family planning?
follow_up_prompts: Would you have genetic testing in future pregnancies?
Are you considering preimplantation genetic testing?
How has this influenced your reproductive plans?

questions.text: Overall, how would you describe your experience with genetic counseling?
follow_up_prompts: What was most helpful?
What could have been better?
Would you recommend genetic counseling to others?

metadata.author: Synthetic Gravidas Research Team
metadata.target_population: Pregnant women undergoing or considering genetic counseling and testing
metadata.note: This protocol covers carrier screening, prenatal diagnostic testing, and decision-making about genetic conditions.
